English: To think (or assess) that someone has a certain quality
To be very poor (to not have a place to drop dead)
To have something/a lot to lose
To have to do with something/someone
To have it difficult or easy

Spanish: No tener ni pies ni cabeza
No tener pelos en la lengua
English: To speak one's mind bluntly, to not mince words

Spanish: No tener ni un pelo de tonto
English: To be not at all foolish
To be final, without turnback or turning of the page
To have or not have an idea, know something

Spanish: Tener la sartén por el mango
Tener un morro que se lo pisa
Tener más cara que la espalda

English: To not have the heart to do something

Spanish: No tener dos dedos de frente
